intro: Englerina heckmanniana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often velvety in texture, and it thrives in bright, indirect light. It is a popular houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Englerina heckmanniana is typically grown in containers and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
